HediffDef.label: lonely
HediffDef.description: Without regular attention, toddlers become lonely and find it harder and harder to keep themselves entertained.

li.label: crawling
li.overrideTooltip: {0} gets around by crawling. Doors are an impassable barrier, and the crib is an effective prison.

li.label: wobbly
li.overrideTooltip: {0} is still slow and unsteady on {0_possessive} feet, but {0_pronoun} gains confidence every day.

li.label: inept
li.overrideTooltip: {0} still struggles with picking up and handling simple objects -- like food and clothes.

li.label: clumsy
li.overrideTooltip: {0} is growing more capable. {PAWN_pronoun} can get food -- more or less -- into {PAWN_possessive} mouth and can undress. Putting clothes back on is more of a challenge.

li.label: confident
li.overrideTooltip: {0} has mastered most everyday manual tasks, and is eager to show off {PAWN_possessive} new capabilities.
